Concept.name: Control Flow
Concept.description: Program execution order including conditionals, loops, branching, and iteration

Concept.name: Data Types
Concept.description: Primitive and composite data types, type coercion, and type basics

Concept.name: Functions
Concept.description: Function definition, invocation, closures, lambdas, higher-order functions, and scope

Concept.name: Data Structures
Concept.description: Arrays, linked lists, hash tables, stacks, queues, trees, graphs, and heaps

Concept.name: Object-Oriented Programming
Concept.description: Classes, objects, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, and abstraction

Concept.name: Functional Programming
Concept.description: Pure functions, immutability, composition, monads, and declarative style

Concept.name: Recursion
Concept.description: Self-referential function calls, base cases, and recursive problem decomposition

Concept.name: Concurrency
Concept.description: Parallel execution, threads, processes, async/await, coroutines, synchronization primitives, and race conditions

Concept.name: Memory Management
Concept.description: Stack vs heap, garbage collection, pointers, references, and memory layout

Concept.name: Ownership
Concept.description: Rust ownership model, borrow checker, lifetimes, and move semantics

Concept.name: Type System
Concept.description: Generics, type inference, traits, interfaces, algebraic types, and type safety

Concept.name: Error Handling
Concept.description: Exception handling, error propagation, try/catch, Result/Option patterns

Concept.name: Metaprogramming
Concept.description: Reflection, macros, decorators, code generation, and compile-time programming

Concept.name: Algorithms
Concept.description: Algorithm design, complexity analysis, sorting, searching, dynamic programming, and greedy approaches

Concept.name: Iterators
Concept.description: Iterators, generators, streams, and lazy evaluation patterns

Concept.name: Design Patterns
Concept.description: GoF patterns, SOLID principles, dependency injection, and architectural patterns

Concept.name: Architecture
Concept.description: System architecture including microservices, monolithic, event-driven, CQRS, and distributed systems

Concept.name: Testing
Concept.description: Unit testing, integration testing, TDD, mocking, code coverage, and test strategies

Concept.name: Security
Concept.description: Authentication, authorization, encryption, common vulnerabilities (XSS, CSRF, SQL injection), and secure coding

Concept.name: Database Concepts
Concept.description: Schema design, normalization, indexing, ACID properties, transactions, and query optimization

Concept.name: API Protocols
Concept.description: REST, GraphQL, gRPC, WebSocket, and API design principles

Concept.name: Caching
Concept.description: Caching strategies, cache invalidation, CDN, and memoization

Concept.name: Version Control
Concept.description: Git workflows, branching strategies, merge conflicts, and collaborative development

Concept.name: CI/CD
Concept.description: Continuous integration, continuous deployment, build pipelines, and DevOps practices

Concept.name: Profiling
Concept.description: Performance profiling, benchmarking, bottleneck analysis, and optimization techniques

Constraint.name: Accessible
Constraint.description: Output must follow accessibility standards (WCAG)

Constraint.name: Backward Compatible
Constraint.description: Changes must not break existing APIs or behavior

Constraint.name: Deterministic
Constraint.description: Same inputs must produce same outputs every time

Constraint.name: Fault Tolerant
Constraint.description: System must handle failures gracefully without crashing

Constraint.name: GDPR Compliant
Constraint.description: Must comply with EU General Data Protection Regulation

Constraint.name: HIPAA Compliant
Constraint.description: Must comply with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act

Constraint.name: Idempotent
Constraint.description: Repeated execution must produce the same result as single execution

Constraint.name: Internationalized
Constraint.description: Output must support multiple languages and locales

Constraint.name: Lock Free
Constraint.description: No mutex, lock, or semaphore primitives allowed

Constraint.name: No Dynamic Allocation
Constraint.description: No heap allocation allowed (stack-only memory)

Constraint.name: No External Dependencies
Constraint.description: Must use only standard library, no third-party packages

Constraint.name: No Recursion
Constraint.description: Must not use recursive function calls

Constraint.name: Observable
Constraint.description: Must include logging, metrics, and/or tracing instrumentation

Constraint.name: PCI-DSS Compliant
Constraint.description: Must comply with Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard

Constraint.name: Performance Optimized
Constraint.description: Must meet specific performance targets (latency, throughput, memory)

Constraint.name: Portable
Constraint.description: Must work across multiple platforms or environments

Constraint.name: Scalable
Constraint.description: Must handle growing load without architectural changes

Constraint.name: Stateless
Constraint.description: No persistent state between function calls or requests

Constraint.name: Thread Safe
Constraint.description: Must be safe for concurrent access from multiple threads

Constraint.name: Type Safe
Constraint.description: Must use strict typing with no unsafe casts or any types

Context.name: Greenfield
Context.description: New project starting from scratch with no existing codebase. Fresh start without legacy constraints.

Context.name: Legacy Code
Context.description: Existing codebase that needs maintenance, refactoring, or understanding. Brownfield development working with pre-existing code.

Context.name: Module
Context.description: Module or package level code organization. Self-contained unit with defined interfaces and dependencies.

Context.name: Monorepo
Context.description: Single repository containing multiple related projects or packages. Shared tooling and dependencies across projects.

Context.name: Multi-file
Context.description: Changes spanning multiple files. Cross-file refactoring, imports reorganization, or coordinated modifications.

Context.name: Repository
Context.description: Repository-wide operations affecting the entire codebase. Large-scale refactoring, dependency upgrades, or project configuration.

Context.name: Single File
Context.description: Complete file with imports and structure. May contain multiple functions, classes, or top-level code in one file.

Context.name: Single Function
Context.description: Complete, runnable function with signature and implementation. Self-contained unit that can be executed independently.

Context.name: Snippet
Context.description: Code fragment or snippet, smaller than a complete function, may lack imports or full context. Common in documentation and tutorials.

Context.name: With Dependencies
Context.description: Code that uses external dependencies or third-party libraries. Requires package management and dependency resolution.

Difficulty.name: Beginner
Difficulty.description: Entry-level coding ability. Involves basic syntax, simple API calls, standard library usage, and fundamental concept understanding.
examples: How do I read a CSV file in Python?
Write a function that reverses a string
What's the difference between let and const in JavaScript?
How do I create a simple HTML form?
Write a for loop that prints numbers 1 to 10

Difficulty.name: Intermediate
Difficulty.description: Mid-level coding ability. Involves framework usage, common design patterns, standard engineering practices, and multi-component coordination.
examples: Build a React component with useState and useEffect
Write a REST API endpoint with Express and validation
Implement authentication with JWT tokens
Set up a basic CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions
Write unit tests for this service class using mocking

Difficulty.name: Advanced
Difficulty.description: High-level coding ability. Involves performance optimization, complex architecture design, deep debugging, multi-system integration, and non-trivial algorithm design.
examples: Optimize this SQL query from 12s to under 500ms
Design a schema evolution strategy for a data pipeline
Fix this race condition in the connection pool
Implement a custom Webpack plugin for code splitting
Write a Solidity contract with reentrancy protection

Difficulty.name: Expert
Difficulty.description: Expert-level coding ability. Involves deep understanding of internals, cutting-edge techniques, large-scale system design, and problems requiring years of domain-specific experience.
examples: Parallelize this Navier-Stokes solver with CUDA
Design a distributed consensus protocol
Implement a lock-free concurrent data structure
Write a custom garbage collector for an embedded runtime
Build a real-time multiplayer game server with rollback netcode

Intent.name: Learn
Intent.description: User wants to understand a concept, technique, or codebase. Response should be educational: explain why, provide context, use analogies, and build understanding progressively.
examples: How does the JavaScript event loop work?
Explain Rust lifetimes to me, I come from C++
What's the difference between processes and threads?

Intent.name: Build
Intent.description: User wants to create new functionality or a new project. Response should be implementation-focused: provide working code, architecture decisions, and practical guidance.
examples: Build a REST API with authentication using FastAPI
Create a Playwright E2E testing framework
Implement Stripe payment integration in Next.js

Intent.name: Debug
Intent.description: User wants to find and fix a problem in existing code. Response should be diagnostic: identify root cause, explain what went wrong, and provide a targeted fix.
examples: This Rust code won't compile, lifetime errors everywhere
My Spark job fails when upstream schema changes
Memory leak in this Go service after running for 3 days

Intent.name: Review
Intent.description: User wants feedback on existing code quality, architecture, or approach. Response should be evaluative: identify issues, suggest improvements, and assess trade-offs.
examples: Review this PR for the payment module
Is this database schema well-designed?
What are the security issues in this code?

Intent.name: Decide
Intent.description: User wants help choosing between options or making a technical decision. Response should be analytical: compare alternatives, present trade-offs, and recommend based on context.
examples: PostgreSQL vs CockroachDB for multi-tenant SaaS?
Should we use microservices or start with a monolith?
Next.js vs Remix for our new frontend?

Task.name: API Design
Task.description: Design application programming interfaces. Define endpoints, request/response formats, and API contracts.

Task.name: Bug Fixing
Task.description: Fix bugs and errors in existing code. Identify root cause and correct faulty logic or implementation.

Task.name: Code Completion
Task.description: Complete partial code or suggest next code snippets. Auto-complete function calls, variable names, or code blocks.

Task.name: Code Explanation
Task.description: Explain how code works. Describe logic, algorithms, and implementation details in natural language.

Task.name: Code Optimization
Task.description: Optimize code for better performance, efficiency, or resource usage. Improve algorithms and data structures.

Task.name: Code Refactoring
Task.description: Restructure existing code without changing behavior. Improve code quality, readability, and maintainability.

Task.name: Code Review Task
Task.description: Review code and provide feedback. Identify issues, suggest improvements, and ensure quality standards.

Task.name: Code Translation
Task.description: Translate code from one programming language to another. Convert between languages or paradigms.

Task.name: Configuration
Task.description: Configure software settings, environment variables, or build tools. Set up project configuration files.

Task.name: Dependency Management
Task.description: Manage project dependencies and packages. Add, update, or remove external libraries and versions.

Task.name: Deployment
Task.description: Deploy applications to production or staging environments. Set up deployment pipelines and infrastructure.

Task.name: Documentation
Task.description: Write documentation for code, APIs, or projects. Create README files, API docs, or inline comments.

Task.name: Error Handling Task
Task.description: Add error handling and validation to code. Implement try-catch blocks, input validation, and graceful degradation.

Task.name: Feature Implementation
Task.description: Implement new features or functionality. Add new capabilities to existing codebase.

Task.name: Logging
Task.description: Add logging statements and instrumentation to code. Insert log messages for debugging and monitoring.

Task.name: Migration
Task.description: Migrate code to newer versions, frameworks, or platforms. Upgrade dependencies or refactor for compatibility.

Task.name: Monitoring
Task.description: Set up monitoring and observability for applications. Configure metrics, alerts, and dashboards.

Task.name: Performance Analysis
Task.description: Analyze and profile code performance. Identify bottlenecks, measure execution time, and optimize resource usage.

Task.name: Schema Design
Task.description: Design database schemas and data models. Define tables, relationships, and constraints.

Task.name: Security Audit
Task.description: Audit code for security vulnerabilities. Scan for common security issues and recommend fixes.

Task.name: Testing Task
Task.description: Write tests for code. Create unit tests, integration tests, or end-to-end tests.
